channel.title: I've been lurking here a bit and I've been wondering
channel.description: How do you guys deal with DDOS attacks, Website hackers, Game glitches, and legal troubles with jagex? I'm totally new to java and interested in doing works with Minecraft and RsPs, so if you were to go through any of the three problems listed, how do you go about countering them?

item.title: I've been lurking here a bit and I've been wondering
item.dc:creator: @naseem142 naseem142
item.description:
@naseem142 wrote:

[quote=“Clawz fury, post:40, topic:538510”][quote author=sinisoul link=topic=657338.msg4398015#msg4398015 date=1389699531]
I’d say it takes about four. That can be accelerated given if you have knowledge of other similar languages.
[/quote]
yeah I’ve been programming in Java for about four years with no previous programming experience and I’m just starting to get into the hard stuff now lol fml[/quote]

It also depends on how fast you can realize things and understand them

Read full topic

item.description:

It would appear that Docent is an absolute retard and doesn’t understand that Java is Java.[/quote]

Ruby… you just made my life. Thanks for this brilliant quote I shall forever cherish.

…Seriously? That’s like the most ignorant comment made on this forum. It’s Ruby who doesn’t understand what I’m saying.[/quote]
You’ve had both me and t4 tell you that the language is the same throughout the different games and you even proved my point by using an analogy showing that in a language two games can be written completely differently. It’s YOU who doesn’t seem to understand that learning a programming language takes more than two weeks and to master a language such as Java it takes years upon years.

item.title: I've been lurking here a bit and I've been wondering
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“yuioplok, post:34, topic:538510”][quote author=t4 link=topic=657338.msg4397877#msg4397877 date=1389657586]

How do you guys deal with DDOS attacks, Website hackers, Game glitches, and legal troubles with jagex? I’m totally new to java and interested in doing works with Minecraft and RsPs, so if you were to go through any of the three problems listed, how do you go about countering them?

DDoS Attacks/Hackers: Having a secure server with high bandwidth and a sane host. Perhaps redundant IPs, etc.

Game glitches: Verify data integrity (pre and post conditions within code) whenever possible.

Jagex: try to operate inside the law as much as you can, don’t get your name out there (stay private), require staff to approve all accounts/access to grey-area/illegal materials. Even at that point you can still be taken to court if Jagex cares enough. In the end you’re probably doomed. Best case is you can sign an agreement with Jagex, but that’s highly unlikely (however, it’s been proven possible). You could also move outside of western jurisdiction (namely china). Many people have fallen victim to Jagex’s legal team - I strongly advise to heed caution. If you’re serious and have monetary goals in mind I suggest talking to a lawyer.

Finally, Java is Java - end of discussion (regarding all of the previous posts in this thread).
[/quote]

So, let’s say they catch me, will they tell me to shut down the server or they’ll sue me, or they’ll just straight up sue me.[/quote]
They will harass you with DMCA notices and if that fails to get your attention they’ll threaten to take you to court, usually first offering a gag order (meaning you’d have to remove all rs hacking related content from your machine, shutdown your hosting, and never visit sites like theses again/release anything). If you violate said gag, you’re liable to get sued.

EDIT: might I also mention they have the time/money to find you if they think you’re a problem. one easy way of finding you is tracking down previous membership/account information.

Read full topic
item.source: I've been lurking here a bit and I've been wondering

So, let’s say they catch me, will they tell me to shut down the server or they’ll sue me, or they’ll just straight up sue me.

How do you guys deal with DDOS attacks, Website hackers, Game glitches, and legal troubles with jagex? I’m totally new to java and interested in doing works with Minecraft and RsPs, so if you were to go through any of the three problems listed, how do you go about countering them?

DDoS Attacks/Hackers: Having a secure server with high bandwidth and a sane host. Perhaps redundant IPs, etc.

Game glitches: Verify data integrity (pre and post conditions within code) whenever possible.

Jagex: try to operate inside the law as much as you can, don’t get your name out there (stay private), require staff to approve all accounts/access to grey-area/illegal materials. item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:30, topic:538510”][quote author=Docent link=topic=657338.msg4397623#msg4397623 date=1389585954]

I don’t really get what he’s trying to say is the issue, I understand where clawz is coming from but you shouldn’t be helping someone and giving advice such as “choose this game or this game if you want to learn a language” because that’s not true at all.

yuioplok, learn the Java language and anything that’s been written in Java you can write code to comply with it (probably the easiest way of putting it).

EDIT: I thought of an analogy.

The sentences: “The apple is red.” and “Red is the colour of the apple.” mean the same thing, however they are worded differently. =
[/quote]

However they’re both written in English and any English speaking person can understand that… The very same with a programming language.[/quote]

mmm i see what you’re saying now.

item.description:
@Evil1 wrote:

[quote=“Docent, post:24, topic:538510”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=657338.msg4397586#msg4397586 date=1389579253]

So, they are the same?

Yes. If you learn Java, you can write code for any application that was written in Java.

@Docent, that’s like me saying “I like to name my main CSS file main.css, I can’t write any code if I call it style.css”. It makes no sense at all.
[/quote]

Go look at Minecraft’s source code. Its java but it isn’t written comparably to RuneScapes.[/quote]Me and Tekk wrote a “mod” base back before bukkit or w/e, it automatically updated just like the old runescape updaters; I don’t understand your logic either

item.source: I've been lurking here a bit and I've been wondering

item.title: I've been lurking here a bit and I've been wondering
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

i think i understand what Docent is saying… think of it like this.

we speak english right? but if you go back in time to the Elizabethan era they speak english too, but you wouldn’t be able to understand half of what they would say

but someone educated enough in english literature would be.

so what I’m trying to say is the advanced programmer will have no problem going from minecraft to rsps, but a novice programmer might have some troubles (not very used to the syntax, so it seems like a completely different language when written another way).

plus the protocol can play a factor in understanding the code. keep that in mind

but yeah no need to start a flame war over something so stupid (coming from me, i know :rolleyes:)

Read full topic

item.title: I've been lurking here a bit and I've been wondering
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

[quote=“Docent, post:15, topic:538510”][quote author=Whackatre link=topic=657338.msg4397569#msg4397569 date=1389577751]

It would appear that Docent is an absolute retard and doesn’t understand that Java is Java.

If you learn the Java language you can write code for any application that uses it. Simple as that. Dealing with legal issues is a whole different ball game, you need to host in countries where certain laws don’t apply, add disclaimers, different legality policies and a whole load more. Dealing with hackers is simple: secure your code and log everything so you can fix it. Denial of Service is just simply to work with a host that provides protection from it.

Thats not what I meant. I meant that (obviously) RuneScape private servers are written much differently than MineCraft’s code. I also mentioned that I prefer the way that RuneScape private servers are written.

What the fudge are you talking about code is code. Just because a different pattern is employed throughout the code doesn’t mean it’s any different, I’ll state it again - if you learn java you can write code for any java application.

he’s evidently oblivious to the fact that he’s completely clueless to what he’s talking about
[/quote]

@Ruby I know JAVA IS JAVA. Games are written differently.

@Whackatre Find a broomstick and shove it up your ass.[/quote]

there is absolutely no need to be so hostile. read your previous posts and figure out why your silly posts are completely irrelevant.

Read full topic

Thats not what I meant. I meant that (obviously) RuneScape private servers are written much differently than MineCraft’s code. I also mentioned that I prefer the way that RuneScape private servers are written.

What the fudge are you talking about code is code. Just because a different pattern is employed throughout the code doesn’t mean it’s any different, I’ll state it again - if you learn java you can write code for any java application.

he’s evidently oblivious to the fact that he’s completely clueless to what he’s talking about

@Ruby I know JAVA IS JAVA. Games are written differently.

@Whackatre Find a broomstick and shove it up your ass.

[/quote]
